Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
from general blockchain rules set, it's good to have 120 conformations for a cryptocurrency to accept securily deposited to an exchange. good enough about of confirmations to count as non-reversible to some extent, to get some level of security satisfaction, depending on that cryptocurrency's network hashing power securing it.
KMD solved that issue of trusting the confirmations of that too long by second layer of Bitcoin hash power security via dPoW consensus rules, for that reason any exchange can just chose to confirm the transaction only after 1 to 2 confirmations and consider them irreversible.
But even after requested an exchange don't change their confirmation times to small number, what else a person can do.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: binance confirmations logic isnt using the dpowconfs, and they dont have logic to detect notarizations

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe the latest version will fix that, but from what we see, it is rawconfirmations they are using

Content: better safe than sorry

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD keeps dozens of coins secure

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with such a timeframe, there is no practical chance to mess with non-notarized blocks, most (all?) the other exchanges automatically use the dpowconfs, so they wait for notarization. without any way to extract hacked funds, KMD has a very small target surface

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all the complaining wont change the fact that security MUST come first

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now, we made some changes so that it is possible with latest version, binance will automatically use the dpowconfs. in that case, we can recommend them to reduce to 3 confirmations
